intro: Oreophylax magellanicus, commonly known as the Magellanic mountain grass, is a perennial grass species native to the southern Andes of South America. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, fibrous root system that helps stabilize soil in high-altitude environments. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine regions and is adapted to cold, harsh climates with strong winds. Its narrow leaves are often covered in a fine layer of hair, which reduces water loss and protects against extreme weather. Oreophylax magellanicus plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing forage for grazing animals and contributing to soil conservation.
